The game has a set of warmups and cooldown exercises (which would be catered to what workouts were done) for every session. At first the it was pretty easy to get through the levels and bosses but at the 2nd boss it actually got sort of hard and I had to grind at other levels to "level up". Overall everything is very enjoyable and it is a fun way to exercise for the whole family. Highly recommended!
title: Fun way to exercise

author: Privacy is nice
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2021
review_content: My back feels better and I'm sleeping better. 10 minutes or stretching and 5-15 minutes of exercise a day depending on my time. I bought a switch just for this "game" Its like having a personal trainer without the monthly costs. Highly recommend for anybody that doesn't feel they are getting enough physical activity in.
title: Used 7 days in a row and plan to use this for the rest of my life or until something better exists.

author: J. K. Daar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019
review_content: I've been feeling fantastic, my desire to game and therefore workout motivates me to check in every morning after a good nights sleep. In the past 6 days I have gone from having the stamina to play for 6-7 minutes at a time to going for almost half a hour, and thus needing to increase the difficulty settings.
title: Nintendo has created a great game and a great workout.

author: Daniel Montes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
review_content: I cannot say I'm losing too many pounds with this game, but at least I'm having fun with my workout.I like that we can select the exercises we want to do during the Story mode, so we can either focus on certain muscles or do a balanced workout, depending on the person selection.For those that love video games and working out at home, and don't mind taking some time to see results, then this is a must have. Otherwise, if you want to quickly lose weight or build big muscles, then you might want to pass on this game.
title: Fun workout

author: Stephen Hanington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: it does a decent job at getting your heartrate up, but most of the workouts are ineffective at actually targetting the muscle groups they say they are targetting, everything effectively ends up becoming a chest/tricep workout if it involves the ringcon regardless of what the screen tells you. The 'core' or 'ab' workouts are a joke as squeezing the ringcon into your stomach does nothing for your abs. furthermore the motion sensors in the joycons are often either too sensitive or not sensitive enough for whatever activity you're trying to do, making it more frustrating to try to get through it, than enjoyable.
title: Can be more frustrating at times than a decent workout

author: Kelym
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
review_content: Both my friend (new to fitness) and me (several years of fitness training as a hobby) enjoy this game a lot! I have a big projector screen set up which probably helped us "feeling the game" properly. But the game is great and the way it combines exercise and gaming makes gym addictive.Slightly cons:1) the exercises that this game covers are mostly strength training-ish. Though it offers yoga poses and some aerobic moves, it is in my impression encouraging strength training. Nevertheless, this is not a problem for me since I can arrange my actual exercise to include more HIIT and stretching.2) the controller that is attached to the leg is a bit harder to use. Especially when I am running around the maze it cannot really tell between a faster pace and a slower pace. e.g. I can cheat to achieve faster pace without moving much, or even when I steps crazily it may still think that I am moving in slow mode.All in all, I love this game. Hope more things like this are out soon!
title: Have been enjoying it a lot!

author: Michaelsluckygirl13
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020
review_content: I absolutely love this game.  It contours to each person.  I started off lower, and worked my way up.  I wanted to see how it was for all aspects of the game.  You can go from a very light work out, to a full on dripping sweat.  My 8 & 11 year old play this as well.  My 8 year old loves this game aspect of it, while my 11 year old is just like me & loves the work out.I just got my husband on it tonight after a week of playing.  He loved it as well.  It’s pretty great cardio, and resistance training.  The magic circle as we call it in our house, is truly what pulled me into this game.  This is a Pilates staple, and I wanted to see what it was all about.  Absolutely not disappointed.I would recommend it to anyone that wants an indoor workout  out in the comfort of your own home.
title: Fun way to get a work out in!

author: Valerie Gurney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2021
review_content: I'm writing this review having just finished the main storyline of the game. 77 days, 27 hours of active gameplay/movement. (There is a new game+ and the option to 100% the old world as well as activities outside the main adventure, so I'm still able to keep playing!)I'll try to keep this short because there's a lot I want to say.I've always had a horrible relationship with exercise due to abuse, bullying, fatphobia, ED, etc.I bought this game not just because of the ongoing pandemic, but my immense discomfort with the atmosphere in public gyms.Previous exercise games I've owned have shamed me for missing days, not exercising as much as they want, etc. Being weighed in Wii Fit and told I was overweight while I had an ED was so damaging to me.Ring Fit does none of those things. It encourages you to exercise within your limits, take breaks if you need to (whether that means in the middle of a session or skipping a couple of days,) and doesn't shame you in any way, not even unintentionally. When I took a multiple week long break from the game after a hospital visit, I was so relieved when the game didn't even mention it at all. They trust you to know what's best for your body.They have a diverse set of exercises to get you through this exercise-based RPG game. Between the battles with enemies, the pretty landscapes, and minigames, you'll be too focused on the gameplay to get lost in your own mind. They encourage you to set reasonable short-term goals, eat healthy outside the game, etc. I couldn't tell you how much weight I've lost since I started playing since, again, past history with an ED, but I can tell you that I am at least happier with my body when I look in the mirror, I have more stamina, I feel more flexible, etc.Don't get me wrong, this game isn't perfect. Especially as someone whose been playing videogames for 2 decades, I've noticed some areas which lack polish, the story is corny, etc. But first and foremost, this game is about exercise, so those details didn't impact my overall score.If there's anything I really had to complain about for this game, it's the fact that you can put an assist mode on all of one type of exercise (legs, abs, arms), but not individual ones. I have poor leg muscles, but I can handle *most* of the leg exercises. I also want to be able to do most of them so I can build up strength in my weakest body parts, but there are specific exercises that I really struggle with and I wish I could put the assist option on only those ones.
title: Repaired My Relationship with Exercise

author: Keirstyn Price
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
review_content: Love silent mode. I hated the idea of running in place, but with silent mode you do squats to move instead. Great idea, keeps me going for much longer, and I love the variety of exercises that I can choose to attack with! Wish I could skip the story part and just play the game but overall I suppose at least the story scenes give me forced breaks between levels. Have fun and get a great work out at your own pace! I'm also THRILLED to note that it lets you calibrate your push and pull strengths separately. I have a shoulder injury that makes it a lot more difficult for me to do those activities and the calibration feature makes it so that I don't hurt myself and overdo it! The pulse monitor is also a really cool feature.
title: Out of shape and falling in love

author: R. Alspaugh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2021
review_content: I got this thinking it would be good for me as I'm disabled and... I was an idiot.I would have returned it but it's not Nintendo's fault and I really hope they continue making things like this.I made a gamble that I would be able to use it and I was wrong. Hopefully some day I'll be able to but for now... it just can't happen due to physical limitations.I really tried though and I was feeling really... loose I suppose is the right word?I built up a sweat and my muscles were stretching. It was nice.The problem is that IIH + workout = bad bad bad.I absolutely recommend this to anyone looking for a workout routine though!!And honestly I look forward to the day that I can do this without being bed ridden for a couple weeks :D
title: It works a bit too well!

author: Breanna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
review_content: This game does not mess around and you will be pouring sweat. It is fun, challenging and exhausting, but very well worth it.It has many features and will calibrate to your experience level and will push you just the right amount with adjustments as you progress further in the game.  It has the best use of turn base battles I've ever dealt with and I am usually not a fan of those types of games. You have warm up stretches and cool down periods. Very nice.The ring itself is strong and I've put a lot of strength on it and no signs of being flimsy at all.Only issues I found is the leg strap, and pads on the rings. If you have big thighs it's a bit hard to keep on. It reccomended to keep part way on your upper thigh, but Ive had to push it practically at the base of my hip and groin to keep it in place. So if anyone has very large thighs might need to make a custom leg strap. The hand pads on the ring should have been a different material as it eventually overheats and irritates the skin.Other than that, it's a great way to lose weight and have fun while doing so.
title: You will feel the burn

author: Luke Clemons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019
review_content: If you literally do no physical activity this is a great way to get yourself moving.The exercises feel appropriately paced but a little funky, due to the odd nature of most of your workout revolving around the tension ring and running in place.Levels are traversed by a light jog in place with the occasional high knee to get through water or up stairs, and battles are fought from simple arm presses, yoga, and other quick rep based workouts. Bosses are essentially individual workouts since Dragaux’s (the main antagonist) health pool is beefy, but pass quickly with a nice average of 8 minutes per level. Check your heart rate after and move on or hop off for the day.The ring has an “away” workout mode where you can do reps (up to 500 recorded) without taking your switch or being connected to the game.I like it! It’s cute and it helps me warm up for the day or cool down after work.
title: Worth it if you don’t hit the gym

author: Tommy0616
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_content: I've not been exercising for almost 2 years, I got it to give it a try, I told my wife "whatever...I will put "intense" difficulty" and omg! After only..11 min, I started to feel nauseated and I had to lower the difficulty. It really gives you a decent workouts and makes you take breaks when its needed. In between the story mode, the individual exercises and mini games, you get a range of good and fun workouts.
title: Don't underestimate its look!

author: Tommy M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
review_content: While I was skeptical at first buying this because it seemed "gimmicky" of sorts, and I was not a huge fan of Wii Fit, I am extremely surprised at how awesome this is as a game/exercise combination. The Adventure mode is easy to follow along with, but the exercises can be quite intense, even for someone who is already in decent shape. I definitely overestimated what I was able to do at first and had to reduce the difficulty.Outside of the fairly in depth adventure mode, there are plenty of other modes and customization options to be able to cater a workout to your skill level, and target what you want (Cardio, Yoga, Arms, Core, Legs, etc.).I really think there is something here for everyone, from the most basic beginners, to a supplemental workout for gym rats. It's honestly perfect for what it is, sturdy construction, and I highly recommend it!
title: Fantastic Exercise Game

author: Shirley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
review_content: Definitely recommend to people who are lacking motivation to workout. I usually don't exercise often, though I always try to, but workout is somehow boring for me so I didn't keep doing it. This ring fit game is amazing! I just got it today and had exercising for three hours already! It was very tiring and some games are pretty intense, but definitely worth it!The mini games are fun and are designed to exercise some different parts of your body, you can definitely feel calories burning and muscle stretching! There are adventure mode(with a story fighting against a monster and get level up etc), fun mini games, set of workout routines, and rhythm based workout. The mini games are my favourite! The game also guides you to do some stretch and relax at the end. I plan to use it every day and will see how long it can go.
title: really great game to motivate you to exercise!

author: Clarissa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019
review_content: BEWARE: If you want to return this item for not liking it (like me), Amazon has a policy that open video games have a refund percentage of 0%!!! Don't buy video games on Amazon to test them out or as gifts because people won't be able to return them!About the game: The game isn't really much fun, super repetitive and hard on the joints. I didn't even get past the first ten levels because it wanted me to do super lower squats for over a minute straight - it's kind of dangerous if you don't know how to do squats. I actually got pretty bored especially because you unlock different exercises so in the beginning you only do four of five different movements. It's not a workout nor a game - I actually measured my calories and in the same time I'll spend just as many doing a Nike workout on their app or going for a run.
title: Don't expect to get your money back if you don't like it

author: J McCarthy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: Okay, I'm not a gamer, and I haven't ever played a video game to work out...but this is a great workout!  It is a little bit different every day with the ability to pick what part of the body you would like to target, yoga, legs, arms, and core.  There is a bit of jogging in place and some high knees.  I am overweight but have been consistently working out for about 6 months now.  I enjoy this workout and will incorporate it into my workout routine for variation.
title: Best Workout Game I've Played

author: Teal S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
review_content: I was super excited to see videos for this game it combines one of my favorite things being video games with an in home workout option! This is not like any other exercise games I’ve personally tried but it’s a lot of fun! I am a big girl and prefer to exercise in the privacy of my own home and this game had me running and jumping stretching and yoga poses. I am excited each day to play! And I feel great after. I would highly recommend! Set up is easy and there are many different places you can go at to make it work for you!
title: Love it would recommend!

author: Sarah Copeland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
review_content: Honestly, at first, I wasn’t sure about buying this game for my 10 year old boy for Christmas this year, even though it was on his list. However, I went ahead and purchased the game and it turned out to be his favorite gift! He has so much fun and gets a ton of exercise while playing. He will play for an hour or more and doesn’t even realize how long he has been playing. It has tons of mini-games that require him to actually get up and move to defeat the monster or win the game.  It’s also good for getting all his extra energy out for days we are cooped up in the house (which is quite often right now due to the pandemic). I highly recommend for any parent of kids who love gaming and could use more exercise in their life :)
title: Highly Recommend!!

author: Ky Burton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
review_content: Nintendo does it again. After a full month with Ring Fit Adventure, I feel energetic and committed to my health. I'm in my late 20s and I hadn't found the right motivation to exercise consistently, but with Ring Fit I find myself popping out of bed in the morning to strap in and get moving. I really love this product; the quality of the Ring itself is surprising on its own, and that the game is inventive and challenging tops it all off. I cannot recommend Ring Fit Adventure highly enough. Thank you, Nintendo.
title: I've never exercised so consistently

author: Mr. S. Rogers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2021
review_content: I bought this for my wife and kids as I thought it would be a fun alternative exercise for them during lockdown. They love it and I'm impressed how well the difficulty adjustments work; making it suitable for both my wife and my 6yo. I was skeptical that it would provide a decent workout, but have been proved very wrong! On the harder settings there is still more than enough resistance and reps to get your heart rate up and muscles working. I've become the biggest user of it in our house and after 30 days can definitely see improvements in health, fitness and particularly posture (albeit from a low base). It won't replace other forms of exercise but it is a nice complement.The main drawback is the "gamification" which has caused some frustration for my wife (not a gamer) and kids (too young to properly understand). At it's heart RingFit is a basic RPG and you will need to earn coins+exp, level up, and strategically accrue and use enhancing power ups. You can still navigate the game without paying too much attention to this, but you will lose (and therefore have to repeat) more "battles" which can be demoralizing and frustrating.
title: Really does improve fitness over time

author: Meijhana
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
review_content: Set up took a little bit but not bad. Worst part is the 'input your age/weight' but unlike Wii fit it doesnt make the avatar fat or short based on your information. It walks you slowly through each exercise till it thinks you've got it. Tipp and Ring keep you motivated throughout. Like all workouts you shouldn't feel acute pain but you will feel the burn if your doing it right. Fun story too. I've had a few times where I'd done a good workout for the day and had to put it down while I wanted to keep going for the story.There are also custom workout modes and mini game modes if you dont feel like doing the adventure at the time. There is also a sort of 'offline' mode that gives you credit in game.
title: It's actually a workout

author: J. Crawford
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020
review_content: This game is lots of fun for the entire family. There are several different modes of play in this game. You can do sets of exercises that target specific areas of the body and are reminiscent of the Wii Fit. There is a mini game mode that provides action without feeling like a workout or taking too much time. I feel like the mini games would be a hit at parties where everyone could compete for the best score. Perhaps the most interesting and fun for the kids is the game mode where the player has to physically move around to play the game. This mode is sure to entertain the kids and the young at heart while making sure they get their exercise in at the same time. The story parts in between worlds was a little bit too long and can be skipped over without taking too much away from the game play.
title: A fun way to get moving

author: Michelle Davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021
review_content: First off, it’s Nintendo, I had high expectations for this product and I was still blown away by this game!!The ring and the leg strap are both super high quality! The ring is super strong and me (a female with very limited strength) and my boyfriend (who can curl 25+lbs) still thought this was a great, tough workout. This can be great for any skill level. The amount of exercise option it has is awesome and it really is a whole body workout. I love that there is a coach to help you through the exercise as well as visuals. I am new to fitness and this is very helpful. There is also options for creating your own workout and it’s amazing to have as an option. Great great game well worth the investment.
title: Funnest workout I’ve ever done

author: LadyVasas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
review_content: I am really happy with this game. I do not enjoy exercising. It's boring and mundane usually, but I know I need too. I have actually pushed myself harder with this game because it makes it enjoyable and I forget (only slightly) that I am working out. I have two young boys who enjoy watching the game and seeing the monsters. We've only had it for two days they beg me every day to play. How can I say no to that?!It's definitely a fun way to get active.
title: Have fun and get fit.

author: edge123
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021
review_content: I played the game part for a few days which was good but it had too much yapping/talking. I then selected the custom option and made several workout routines on there.  I stinking love it!!!!  Do the custom option!!! It is your way to do an at-home boot camp.  Set up 5 or 6 routines to really get the boot camp sweat going!!!!
title: Love this for an In-home boot camp!!!!

author: Mote
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_content: Was not really expecting much and was actually expecting to be let down and just another gimmick. We go this on Christmas and I have been playing it 4-5 days a week for about 30 mins each session. I am currently using it before my weights training and it has been a great addition. Sometimes it surprises me when I'm actually sore the next day from what would appear to not be that great of a workout. It has kept me very engaged and motivated to keep going. I have been playing for about a month now. I am currently level 33 and I keep unlocking new exercises.Another great thing is that instead of like the normal Switch games you do not select your profiel before entering the game. You don't select your profile until you are already in the game. This way everyone playing can see each others stats and it kind of keeps everyone competing. This has been a great help keeping my kids motivated to play after they see that I am a good deal ahead of them.The only problem that I have noticed with the game is that some of the exercises are split left/right exercises. Some of the enemies if you kill them before you get to the other side, then on that particular exercise you are overworking one side while not hitting the other side at all. I wish they would fix this because the game should know how many hits it would take to kill the enemy so they could split it 50/50.Overall, this has been the greatest workout game that I have ever played and I'm sure I will still be playign it for a long time.
title: Top Workout Game!!

author: Acacia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020
review_content: Just got this game because I've been on the COVID slump. The wheel thing is a pilates resistance ring. The game walks you through setup, and has difficulty adjustment with fun game modes including adventure RPG mode which all track your time and calories, also letting players add a reminder timer on the switch itself.. the detection on the controllers is extremely accurate. I was blown away when discovering the heart monitoring feature in my joycon.Before you know it, you'll be sweating but mostly sore after completing a workout and will want to keep going. It is a fun investment and I recommend for those that need some fun to get into being active, especially during COVID when most of the gyms are off-limits or not ideal to visit.Update: as of a few months later I'm getting muscles in places I'd never imagine lol, but this game will make you lean up and definitely get you in shape. I have the energy to do a 5K now when I barely could run three blocks before I started. Love this game. The dragon guy is a bit scary though.
title: Makes working out FUN

author: Misty321
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
review_content: I love this game.  I've had a hard time getting myself to exercise since the pandemic because I can't go to the gym or do group classes anymore.  Ring Fit doesn't really burn that many calories per minute, but it's fun and gets me to actually move and exercise every day.  I play in adventure mode to keep myself interested, but if you want something more focused or you're short on time, you can create workouts with their exercise sets, either targeting a specific muscle group or just an all-over workout.  There's also mini-games for something in between the two options.  You can increase the strength and difficulty level to up the workout you're getting as well.  It's also super cute and comes in multiple languages, though I've noticed some of the translations are a little off.  Overall, a cute, fun way to get back into exercise.
title: Fun way to get back into exercise

author: Chelsea Gamboa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020
review_content: I've never really enjoyed exercising with a set of reps of certain exercises, usually I just go for a run every day. Ring Fit Adventure makes it a lot of fun to do reps and teaches you the proper way to do lots of exercises. It's really helping me with strength training on top of my daily runs. I've played every day for a little over a month and I'm still not bored. The skill tree is a fun way to have character progression and it is fun to select certain exercises that are strong against the baddies. I'm still not 100% of the way through the main story line so there is plenty of game for your money. I do feel a lot stronger but you can increase the difficulty of the game as exercises get easier.
title: Great fun exercises! Great for people who get bored doing reps!

author: Kindle Unlimited Reader Little Starr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: Every day after school I have the kids do their homework. After completion they do ring fit. I have a child who is naturally athletic and one who is stationary and uncoordinated. They love it. My one who hates gym is enjoying this.  The other is still challenged and since it has casual to hard we can set it for him. I have done it and being a bad adult need to do it more, but will say it includes stretching and other workouts that target, but don't make you feel like you are bored on a treadmill. Great game for all ages and a good work out that has setting for any level.Update... started the non game section that is just targeted exercises. EXCELLENT!!!  Really enjoying this!
title: This is now part of our daily routine

author: Tuan A Le
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020
review_content: Since I am not familiar with any of this kind of computer game, I ordered this game cause it shows some physical activities playing it.The box came, I opened it and try to understand it and couldn't understand how this work after a minute or two, then I looked at the pictures on the box and realized that it'd missed a  piece of electronic part that inserts into the ring and the leg band.  At that moment I not only realized that it came without a crucial part, but I also realized how little I know about these kind of things. My son of 11 would know much better right off the box. Kakaka ..It definitely has to go back, I will order another one, hoping things will be right this time.
title: Product came missing part.

author: Robin D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2021
review_content: I started exercising with YouTube videos during quarantine, although a lot of videos are super intense and helpful, but none of them keep me doing it for a long time. Ring Fit really change me, once I started using it I never stop for a week. It’s so fun that reduces half of the pain in work out.  And I love the healthy tips keep reminding me drink more water and eat healthy. After about 2 months of Ring fit and kind of healthy eating I lost almost 10 pounds and can already see some muscles lines! Thanks a lot to Ring fit!!☺️☺️☺️
title: Best quarantine buddy

author: Neko
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2021
review_content: The equipment this game comes with, the ring and leg strap are well made and durable. I was originally concerned about the longevity of the ring, especially since you squeeze it a lot, but after using it I'm very impressed with it's quality. I definitely couldn't break it no matter how hard I squeezed or pulled. The game also tells you your heart rate after a work out and calculates your burned calories after each level and gives you total calories burned when you're finished and flung your cool down, very helpful.The game itself is really fun and I often find myself wishing I could continue passed the point I need to quit due to being worn out from the work out. This has motivated me to turn working out into a habit for the first time in my life. Combined with diet I've already lost weight and feel healthier. I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
title: Working out for the first time in my life

author: Jade
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2021
review_content: Woo! I haven’t worked a lot since covid and exercising with a mask is a struggle so I’ve been trying to find things to do at home just to get me off my butt and moving. This was super fun! I already want to play again after yesterday lol. I love the silent mode because I live in an apartment so running would cause a lot of noise and the little squats get the job done! I highly recommend, I’m not expecting to lose a ton of weight but I think this is definitely that will help metabolism move out of stasis lol I think it’s going to definitely help me build some strength too so I’m very excited. If I get some good results I’ll add to my review!Also for those gamers out there, I heard you can actually use the ring with Zelda too. Might give that a shot soon
title: Fun, challenging and apartment friendly!

author: Kenneth felipe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: I got my abs back. I still go to the gym twice a week and I use this 3 to 4 times a week. I was only about 10 or 15 pounds overweight. Not anymore. I customize it and do the calisthenics and the ab work out. The adventure games fun and it is a bit challenging sometimes. I highly recommend this.I have lost 20 pounds and it’s pretty fun. The only con is the strap that you wrap around your leg sometimes it falls off but definitely not a subtraction. I got this and rebooted my body. You will sweat.
title: I got my abs back

author: ElizabethRivers33
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
review_content: I’ve been playing everyday for a month and just passed level 100! I can say without a doubt that this is one of the best games I’ve ever played and it far surpasses Wii Fit Games in terms of a solid exercise game. Characters are funny and charming and the “attacks” aka sets, are all very effective and I’m glad I’m not forced to do use any specific moves on a regular basis. 10/10 game will keep playing for a long time!
title: Best Exercise Game Ever Made

author: Kayleigh Joiner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019
review_content: I usually don't write reviews for products I buy on Amazon, but I wanted to share how GREAT this game is. You get a great workout from this, I usually start sweating in minutes of playing the adventure mode. There are options to adjust the level of difficulty to best suit your level of fitness. There are even settings to change some exercises to button presses, should you have an injury or disability that makes certain exercises more difficult for you. The HD rumble in this is really good. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a fun way to add some exercise to their daily routine.
title: Offers varied difficulty settings to meet any fitness level

author: Lamiai
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019
review_content: A bit 'expensive' to most because it comes with hardware but it's really fun. I've tried on Low, Medium, and High difficulty and this game can make you sweat! Based on the difficulty, you can still choose if you want to take it easier/harder on a per stage basis, or even 'per turn' in combat. It gives you plenty of chances to take a break. It even has a function that really shocked me - It uses the sensor of the joycon to take your HR in between stages to help monitor caloric burn, etc.Over-all, super fun experience and highly recommend even at full price.
title: Loving this game!

author: Tonya D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: sure it doesn't have the greatest graphics, and the story line is a bit weird.  but this game is super fun.  I am someone who doesn't work out, exercise, or otherwise have a lot of physical activity going on in my life.  I was able to choose settings appropriate to my (lack of) fitness level (haha), and have been playing for a few days now.  I'm not in shape at all and the easiest setting is giving a challenge, but not discouraging or un-doable.  I hope to increase the difficulty over time. I actually feel motivated to keep doing this, when this type of thing isn't something I'd normally be doing.I would say if you are someone who is already hitting the gym every day and in great shape, this game probably isn't going to do much for you.  but for others like me or more or less live a couch potato lifestyle, and want to take steps to being more active without the embarrassment of trying to do it in public (or feel humility of being unable to keep up with exercise videos) - I say Ring Fit Adventure is made for us!
title: this game was made for me!

author: hannah francheski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: I was so psyched to get this game. It played it twice with the game difficulty set at moderate/medium as I consider myself relatively in shape. Well I guess I was wrong. I pulled my shoulder out the next day and it stayed like that for a week. It was terrible. If you get this game start on easy!!
title: Injury from playing this

author: Rye
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020
review_content: I’m the type of person who hates exercising and normally has to force themself to do it. I got this game in hopes that it would fix that problem for me so that I could enjoy my workouts. And it worked! When I first got the game, I became disappointed because my muscles would be sore the next day and I couldn’t keep playing! I really look forward to exercising now and I can see myself replaying the game over and over just for the health benefits. The story mode will eventually end for me but I don’t mind that because it’s the gameplay that I enjoy. Most of the game is exercising rather than plot anyway, so it wouldn’t matter much if you had to start over. A lot of people mentioned that the leg strap slides down, but I don’t have that problem. Maybe it’s because I have smaller thighs or because I strap it onto bare skin, but it stays on for my whole workout.
title: Can’t stop playing!

author: Garon S. Bradley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020
review_content: So I go to the gym often, I weight train and do some cardio too and am 160 lbs.  This game.. WORKS your ass off. No joke.  If you want it to be hard difficulty ohhh man, you can make that happen and it will kick your butt.  Of course you can go easy mode and all, but the point of the game is to push yourself.  For me the squats and the ring holds get very tough after 2 or 3 sections of play.  It WILL be a full on workout on hard difficulty like no other if your worried it will be too easy.  You can deliberately do the ring and squat leg exercises and challenge yourself.  Of course, users may vary, but for certain, you can make it extremely hard or extremely easy, it will be easy if you set it to easy and pick and choose easy exercises.  But if you just do 2 or 3 sections a day on hardest difficulty and only focus on the exercises you struggle with, this game works like no other.
title: This is a workout.  No joke.

author: Phaedra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
review_content: Ok this game is fantastic! My five year old is OBSESSED with legend of Zelda, and has been wanting to play all the time. I bought this as a way to compromise between active play and game time, and he's in love! The graphics are super kid friendly, the music is upbeat, and the instructions are easy to follow. I helped him do the moves the first few times, but pretty soon he had it down. He's gulping down water and can't wait to play more! It has an actual adventure so it really feels like a game, not just a workout. The strap for the leg is a little loose but it doubles over no problem. The ring that comes with it is super sensitive so as long as you let the kids calibrate it themselves, you won't need to buy one specifically for kids. Honestly I can't wait until I finally get a turn! Absolutely recommend for any family!
title: Gamer kid (and mom) approved!

author: cmccask
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
review_content: People on here have complained that this game is a joke. But for us, it really had helped! If you do the exercises the right way, it makes a big difference. My legs are so sore today from doing 200+ squats yesterday to beat Drageaux.  The ab workouts have been great for me, too. I’m a busy mom of two littles and the game is fun because I can workout at home and my kids don’t mind watching it. I really have so many positive feelings about this game. I’m down 16 lb and my husband is down 20 (we’re also eating healthy).My ONLY con: I can get 30 minutes of working out in but it takes an hour because of the game dialogue. But still, it’s nice that it only times your active workout minutes, so there’s no cheating on how long the workout is
title: Fun way to get into better health & shape

author: Aram B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021
review_content: I've been trying to find an exercise routine that made it fun for me while I was working out! I've tried everything but I never got past day 2 without giving up on exercise completely! I never liked doing the same thing over and over again! To me, that was just plain BORING! Sorry, not sorry! However, this game for someone like me who is just starting is JUST PERFECT! It's fun, you have multi-worlds, you earn more sets and reps and whatever you'd call them! It advises on staying hydrated and posture maintenance and such.... It's sooooo much more FUN! I always hit random and it never fails me! I love it, I love it A LOT!!!!
title: A DEFINITE RECOMMENDATION!!!!!

author: pikachoose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020
review_content: This game has a boring storyline already unless you’re like under 14 years old and/or find monsters in boxers onesies attractive. What exactly does the an guard do? It only just makes you continue playing with an ugly monster. I workout 3-7x a week, occasionally I don’t want to so I play this. It’s not as great as the gym but the abs guard is an extreme turnoff and ridiculousness. Don’t just take my word, you can look it up.I don’t know what Nintendo is thinking.
title: Abs guard is nonsensical

author: Superstar_Cheryl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021
review_content: This is an awesome get fit game. I have gained over 20lbs during the pandemic and I needed something that will be fun, a challenge, but not makes me hate working out.  This checked all the boxes for me and it even takes your heart rate. I was able to set my skills to 2nd from the lowest level just to ease my way back into working out and that was way too easy and that was after not working out for months.  My son is a High School Varsity football player and he set his level to the highest and he was sweating and said the workouts were just as hard as his school workouts.  I am not ready for that level but it was very worth buying this game.  The only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars is that sometimes it takes several times to check my heart rate, saving the game can be hard and I had to redo a workout upon logging back in, and just trying to navigate as a beginner is just hard.
title: Great Game and Rules are easy to follow but...

author: marsmars13
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
review_content: Lo compre porque oí buenas críticas y pensé que me podría servir como complemento para mis sesiones de entrenamiento que en la cuarentena se habían vuelto monótonas y aburridas. Increíble artefacto y además muy entretenido. Soy escalador de roca, montañista y corredor de trail, la verdad creo que este curioso aparato me ha encantado. A pesar de que ahora ya hay menos restricciones para salir seguiré usandolo pues creo que me ha servido, así como divertido mucho.  TOTALMENTE LO RECOMIENDO como complemento o para alguien que no haga tanta actividad física y quiera hacer algo de manera entretenida aunque el nivel es ajustable desde muy fácil hasta bastante más duro.
title: Otra vez Nintendo siendo increíblemente creativos

author: Karol Gonzalez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020
review_content: I think this is one of the best investments I made before the quarantine. I don't like doing exercises so I used to dance everyday as an exercise. But covid happened and I was not able to do it anymore. Lucky for me, I had the ring fit adventure. This is a super entertaining way to do exercises. You don't even realize how much you've worked out until you finish for the day. It's addictive! I also like to compete with my husband about who's in the higher level.
title: Life saver!

author: Kimberly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2019
review_content: I purchased this as a Christmas gift and the outer box/packaging was fine but inside, the product/game box was damaged. If it wasn’t a gift it might not be as much of a big deal but what a bummer.
title: Damaged box

author: TheHadouJHyrule
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021
review_content: This game really does give you a work out, but there’s just one problem I have with it. The game puts dynamic stretching, and the exercise ahead of static stretching. Static stretching before an exercise is important because if you don’t staticly stretch prior to exercising, there’s always that risk of injury. This game fails to compel that message. Had it done, so I would’ve easily given it five stars. Because of this being the scenario, I can only give it two stars, since it will leave most people very sore after working out with injury like soreness. If it didn’t give you a work out at all, I would’ve rated it one star.
title: Puts Dynamic Stretching and Exercise ahead of Static Stretching

author: Kallen Amos
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
review_content: I'm glad the Switch finally got a game on par with Wii Fit, which was my gf's old staple before upgrading consoles. Is always hard to work exercise into our routine, considering our different sleep schedules, so I got this 'on a whim and a prayer', but was surprised how much she enjoyed it!She's now using this weekly, and last I checked had cleared quite a few stages, character level 25 in hardly a month! I tried it out too and was content with it, happy to see there are settings to configure resistance levels of the ring, to conform to different workout intensity levels and/or overall body capabilities. Also appreciated the variance in movesets each level brings, so you're not overworking specific muscle groups, plus a certain level of customization in which exercises you wish to focus on.Not sure how many stages there are, but if there is a limit, hoping for some form of New Game+ to keep gf engaged, since it's been a long while since she's been so enthused to work out :D I'd also gladly drop money for a sequel at this rate!
title: Gamer gf motivated to exercise!

author: VioletRiot
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021
review_content: This game has a lot of different modes, nice customization ability, the option to remind you to work out, this game does everything it advertises, for the most part. If you're honest with what you're looking for, and aren't a huge gym rat, this can give you a decent workout from your switch. The only major issue I have with this game is that the Right Joycon is allegedly able to read your pulse, but it doesn't ever really work. A part of me is just unnaturally irked by stuff like this, and I don't expect Nintendo to care enough about its products or consumer base to give any hand in fixing busted or dysfunctional components like an Infrared sensor. I would rate this product as lower than 4 stars because I'm petty but the game itself gets the job done and done well in terms of exercise.
title: Gets the Job Done

author: Nikesh Patel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020
review_content: I was surprised by how well this works. Sure the joy cons only need to recognize some sort of movement for the leg strap, but the ring is well designed and comfortable. It's certainly much more sturdy than it appears.They recently added more game modes if you need a break from the story campaign. I would like to see more running/endurance modes on there. Sometimes it's nice to have a long workout in the house, that's also a little mindless.
title: Very intuitive game and design

author: s82739
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020
review_content: I've heard of people having their parts not working after a couple sessions but mine has been fine so far. This game is great for exercise and I highly reccomend it to people who find working out boring. Hopefully this will make exercise for interesting. There are a couple different options for exercise, like adventure mode, custom work outs, one with music (no it's not DDR or zumba lol) and a quick workout mode. Theres probably more that I havent discovered yet. But it has great features like heart monitor, tips for healthy life style, and it calculates some stats based on your weight and height. You can personalize it and choose which level of difficulty you want. You also have the option of changing the difficulty each time you start up the game. Another option is having alternatives for jumping or running. It's great for people who are worried about bothering their downstairs neighbor.
title: Great!

author: onyxfyrefly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
review_content: I absolutely love this game. It is super customizable and it challenges you without making you feel bad about your fitness level. I have a Wii fit and I love the games but you have to weigh yourself each time you play. I don't want a reminder of my weight gain every time I want to work out. The ring only asks for your weight in order to calculate calories burned.My favorite part is that there is a Silent Mode where you can do squats instead of running in place. I live on the second floor of an apartment and I'm sure my neighbors are thrilled that I'm not running in place at 5 am.The only thing I would caution future buyers is that there is a thigh strap for the left joycon. I'm on a fitness journey but I've had thunder thighs since I was born. The strap fits around my thigh but only just. I think the dimensions are mentioned in the product description.Aside from that it's great and I hope they come up with a new game soon!
title: Thick Thighs Save Lives But They Can Restrict Gameplay

author: JO11YGR33N
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2021
review_content: I bought this game for my kids at the end of the school year to keep them active. At first my daughter was really into it but once it became work her interest in the game desolved. My wife really likes it and set up a routine. If my physical disabilities didn't prevent me from playing this game I would have been all over it. I would recomend this game to anyone that wants to increase their stamina, and if you are sharing the equiptment with someone else it would be a good idea to get a second set of straps. If you are putting forth any kind of real effort you are going to sweat.
title: This is basically a fun exercise coach

author: coolbarkms
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020
review_content: I am not a fitness enthusiast. NY often snowed and was very cold when I bought it. Therefore, although I joined the gym and walked for 5 minutes from my house, I didn’t want to go. I paid $ 55 per month for a gym, and for this game, plus the credit card points I deduct, it is almost the same, and I can use it countless times.I don't need to spend half an hour changing clothes and preparing towels, slippers and shower gels every time I want to exercise. I can start exercising directly in my sleepwear, and the amount of exercise is sufficient (for me). And in the game, when you complete the task by doing sports, your "partner" will always encourage you "you did a great job" so that I can stick to it.I highly recommend it to anyone who likes to sit and work in the office for a long time, too lazy to go to the gym and want to lose weight.
title: Much fun and really has a fitness effect

author: Kyle Smeby
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2021
review_content: Welcome to Ring Fit where every day is leg day! I play at difficulty level 18 with wrist weights on because while I'd like to turn the difficulty up it's already destroying my legs on a regular basis (which is probably a good thing).Some of the exercises don't play well with the sensors, and the logic behind which exercises do the most damage is best not to think about, but the fact is this is way more fun than mindless cardio and calisthenics. Lots of goals and things to keep your mind engaged so you can grind out a workout with some entertainment value.
title: Weird but effective

author: Ashley B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021
review_content: This game is fun! I hate working out as I have barely any discipline. My husband bought this for our 7 yr old, but I decided to try it too. I will continue to use it for my 30 mins a day (or more). I am also impressed that the syncing between the movements to the game is impeccable. I used to hate when the wii wouldn't count moves that you were doing correctly.  Definitely recommend.
title: Fun while exercising!

author: Kate Estevez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020
review_content: We love our switch in our house, but honestly we hadn’t really thought about using it for the whole fitness aspect. We finally buckled and bought this and honestly, I didn’t have a lot of high hopes for it. Thankfully, I was wrong. I like the game that comes with it, it’s easy to do the exercises, but it’s entertaining enough to keep me interested. I didn’t have the best success with the heart rate monitor thing, but other than that it works great and I really like it.
title: Great for indoor exercising

author: shota
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2020
review_content: Let me start this off by saying I'm a lucky person blessed with a high metabolism—I'm extremely light as is. However, my activity level is practically sedentary while doing all my work from my room during these times.So, on day one this game was straight up kicking my ass. I only played for about 30 minutes but I was sore for the next two days. I played again once the soreness left and, to my surprise, I did not experience that soreness again. My balance has also improved, tying a shoe while standing on one leg no longer has me wobbling.I think this is a great purchase for someone looking to get a little activity into their routine with some fun. I would say not to a super high intensity workout that will grant you bulging muscles, but think what you will.
title: Pain

author: Saekit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
review_content: I play this almost every day and after a couple weeks I'm really feeling a difference in my body's strength. I used to exercise a lot, but haven't for a few years now, so this was a great entry back into getting myself healthy again.I usually exercise with this for 15~25 minutes (going by their "moving time", so that's like 30~40 actual minutes) and that usually gives me a nice sweat.Some moves are easy, some more difficult, but I think this game balances it out pretty well.10/10! Here's hoping my ring con will last for years to come.
title: Awesome exercise game!

author: Amber Anderson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2021
review_content: This game is amazing!! I've never been the athletic type and have had 3 children (had a baby last year)...needless to say even the thought of having something that looked like abs was a farfetched idea for me up to this point (34 female). BUT let me tell you this game got me up and going! I've been going 55 days strong and feel like I have a new body! Abs are forming, I can see the muscles in my thighs, and my core is trimmer than ever! Ring Fit is literally changing my life....simple things that would tire me out are manageable now! The game is easy to navigate, great workouts, tons of tips and facts to help you improve your body and lifestyle. It tracks every single workout and provides you with cumulative data which really feels good. Oh I've done 200 squats so far?? Alright! If you are thinking about getting off the couch but need some motivation...BUY THIS.
title: Fantastic Workout Game!!

author: Potatotuber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
review_content: Stopped working after using it a couple times. I know it's not my switch because my other games work. Wont be purchasing a game like this from amazon again.
title: Broke after a couple uses

author: Pam McAssey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2019
review_content: I am giving this a 4* review due to the fact that the Adventure part is fun but a little childish. I do work up a sweat with the game now that I have worked through some levels. Like others said it is heavy on squats and your arms do get a work out from the resistance band. I would have liked to see the character be a little heavy in the beginning and see her/him start to trim down and get muscle strength as you progress :-) All in all it is a fun game to have around when you can not get outside for your run. However the $79.00 price tag is a little steep.
title: Fun and does get you moving

author: Ghrizlee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021
review_content: My wife and I got really lazy over the past few years and especially during this pandemic. Ever since a friend suggested this game my wife and I play this game everyday. It’s fun and can be challenging but because we’re both competitive, we end up really getting a workout. If you hate working out but want to start somehow, this is the best way.
title: Lazy couple works out now everyday!

author: Robin D. Nankin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
review_content: I dislike working out. It’s boring, it hurts, it’s costly for gym memberships, and as a newbie I am confused, frustrated and intimidated. This game really makes me feel I can do it. It motivates me, teaches me, and makes it fun to work out. Before each section, it will say how many minutes and estimated calories you’ll burn. They are in easy little segments from 2-6 minutes. I have my settings on beginner mode, so it also reminds me gently to take breaks and not do too much which I really appreciate. I’m on day 2 and I am excited to work out daily. I think for higher difficulties it will change many things and I imagine that it would be fun and exciting for higher level people too.
title: Super great for someone who hates working out

author: Tafne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2021
review_content: Let’s face it during this time of COVID we all gained a pound or two. Going back to the gym makes me a bit spectacle due to my immune system being so bad. I looked for a product that could be fun and entertaining not just for me but for the whole family. I suffer from fibromyalgia and it’s hard to feral with the pain and stiffness in my body.  Since I started working out with this product I have lost 6 lbs and moving better. Although I’m still in pain I feel it helps me a lot because it gives an opportunity to work out the whole body or areas at a time. So it allows me to work on my trigger points that need more help on that day if needed. My kiddos love it and it becomes a race to see who does better. I recommend it to be honest oh I also love that you can change the language so when my mother plays it’s in Spanish for her. Thank you guys for making a great product.
title: Fun for the whole Fambam

author: Jenn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021
review_content: Absolutely love this game!Actually wish I bought it on release day.This game is fun, engaging and addictive.I usually hate doing exercise; in my life it’s been more of a punishment for poor diet and habits than anything else.This game makes exercise a reward!So to explain this game- you strap a controller to your leg and hold the other that’s attached to this flexible ring and run in place to get from level to level in the game. The scenery is fun and interactive. To mix it up there are encounters with cute little monsters (they have resemblance to gym equipment) you have to defeat them to progress the story- save villagers, collect items,stop the big bad buff dragon and so on.In order to combat the critters- you choose exercises (and it’s nice to have them separated into categories - arms- torso- legs - yoga)The exercises are assigned stats that will do a certain amount of damage if performed correctly. Kind of a turn based combat system like final fantasy or dungeons and dragons.Anyway the moves are real life exercises- mountain climbers, leg lifts, squats(so many squats!!) and various yoga moves.Which makes it more rewarding as you can apply those moves in the gym and actually see progress.The game has a helper called till that will show you how to do the move off to the side and what muscles you’ll be working for that exercise.The ring you manipulate- it’s flexible and extremely durable acts as a guide for your movements and in game as a coach, guide and cheerleader.I could go on and on…But I’ll leave my review of the best purchase I be made this year here.I wish you the best of luck and hope you decide on purchasing this game. Hopefully there will be a sequel coming soon as well!
title: Best Purchase

author: Ryan C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021
review_content: It has taken us months to get this game because we weren't going to pay hundreds of dollars to buy it during the recent quarantine. But we wanted to have a game that would get our kids up and active since a lot of parks and playgrounds have been closed down. This game is great! We have only tried the story mode, which has a pretty weak story (but what do you expect from a game that is only meant to be for exercise?). With varying levels of difficulty based on age, weight, and current fitness level, it's easy for anyone to use. All of our kids (ages 4 up to 13) take turns playing the game. I have used it a few times myself, and while it's not the same as going to the gym, it's a pretty good burn.
title: Fun way to keep the family active

author: JC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.                       I've been playing the adventure part of this game. It's too fun. I'm a bit of a nerd and put the audio on Japanese because it makes me feel like a video game character. (Whenever there is important plot dialogue, I enjoy the English subtitles.) The video shows a battle exercise with that setting.The set up is very easy to understand. Cute and helpful exercises. I haven't yet had problems with Switch as I did with the Kinects (some games had trouble with my small space to play.) So that's great!  I'll update if anything changes.
title: Easy to set up, fun features

author: Kyle Mizell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021
review_content: My 6 year old can't put this thing down. What a great tool to keep them active while fulfilling their desires to be doing something on a screen. This game is extremely well designed and every detail carefully thought out. It's really fun for him, and it's even fun to watch him play.The ring controller is fantastic. It's very sturdy, and like other Nintendo controllers, it's amazing how accurate it is in measuring your interactions with it.You need this game and controller, your family will love it.
title: Fantastic Game, Great Fitness Tool For Kids

author: Hang Nguyen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2020
review_content: I've been trying to buy a RingFit for MONTHS and finally got one in the few minutes it was in stock. My husband and I love it. I can't get him to work out any other time except now. He's super motivated because he loves video games and wants to beat this game too, even if it means working out to do so.Excellent for gamer husbands/boyfriends
title: FINALLY GOT IT

author: Samantha
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: I got this for my husband and I as a replacement for going to the gym. I regularly go to the gym, but I'm not in great shape, just your average build. My husband never goes to the gym. For me this was like a good warm up, it got my heart rate up and my breathing was heavier, but I wouldn't classify it as a full workout for myself. My husband however did the same difficulty level and felt like it was a good workout and couldn't have done more according to himself. I think this is a great option for people who workout and don't have time to make it to the gym and I think it's great for people who don't work out but wanna get more active without the pressures of the gym! Great for everyone!
title: Great for people who do and don't workout regularly

author: Jason Luna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2020
review_content: I got this game because of any story, but also to work on out on my Switch, and that's about right. The workouts are great, lots of depth with cardio of running, and a lot of weird depth from the squeezable wheel that really helps build muscle. The story about fighting a dragon is generic and middlingly charming, but it keeps you engaged and is passable. So a successful workout game, an ok to low game game, but great workout!
title: An exercise game with a story and surprising depth

author: Chris R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2020
review_content: Wow, I can't believe how much of a sweat I work up with this! It's definitely a fun and innovative way to exercise and, yes, you'll certainly feel the burn after using. It does a great job of guiding you through things and adding in a variety of exercises as you advance through the game. There is a lot of jogging/running in place which can cause a bit of noise but there's an ability to turn that off and replace that action with squats. I certainly recommend this if you're looking for a fun way to become more active!
title: Great Workout!

author: Emily H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021
review_content: This is so cool! I like how there are different things you can do on this game. The actually adventure mode itself is really fun and gives you a great workout. This is a definite step up from the Wii Fit Board. It makes you do different exercises from working out your legs, butt, stomach, and arms. Just really enjoy this game very much!EDIT: There is one Con I forgot to throw in. The leg strap doesn't fit very well on someone with thicker thighs and does have a tendency to slip down while you're moving around.
title: So Cool!

author: Brianna B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021
review_content: If you are even considering getting this game, JUST DO IT! I am so happy I did. For the record, I'm a 25 year old woman who has been rather depressed and basically haven't done any sort of exercise in a very, very long time. This game has had me exercising multiple times a day and actually enjoying it. The adventure aspect of the game is really cool and makes it so much fun! This game has a variety of exercises that target different areas of your body. I highly recommend this game!!! So much fun and productive at the same time.
title: GET THIS GAME!!!! JUST DO IT!!

author: Kathy BB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_content: Finally got a copy after months of checking back to catch it in stock. This game will have you SWEATING while having a lot of fun. Really like that you can adjust the difficulty settings so it won’t be a one-and-done game. You can track your workouts, weight, heart rate, and burned calories. I’d recommend this to any and everyone. I’m just getting back into exercising and it actually makes that manageable. It’s challenging but not stressful. And it’s good to know once I get more in shape I can bump the difficulty up to keep up.
title: Worth the wait! Get this game!

author: Carissa Fei
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_content: I just generally overall like the idea better than wii fit, as its actively working out your body. I fell in love with the idea as soon as the trailer was annouced. The ring itself is very sturdy, as its build in game to tell you to push and pull the ring but after a few reps with that thing, your body will shake a bit, as your muscles are getting tired.My first run with this, the day after, my muscles were aching the next day. I do not exercise at all and I was tired by the first world. I was only on the average difficulty. I watch a review on youtube and the hardest difficulty is killer!I would recommend if you have a hard wood floor to get a mat, to help cushion your feet, and your running shoes.Overally an excellent game for light-mid weight exercise that works on your whole body, reminds you to drink water and take breaks, and a good trick for exercise.
title: Love it!

author: Carlieflower
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
review_content: I love this game. Honestly I haven't checked my measurements or weight again since I started but I love this game so much I play every weekday. My endurance is definitely better. It's really fun. Reminds me of wiifit but WAY better. Younger kids who love video games and need a little exercise will love it too. Perfect for rainy days inside. So much fun. I'm smiling the whole time and feel GOOD! I just had a baby a bit ago and I have bad knees and I'm able to do this, I just make sure not to push myself too hard.
title: If you're on the fence go for it.

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021
review_content: I bought this and another pilates ring for my GF and I to work out together. We both think it's a great workout. Each "world" seems to take about 30 minutes depending on your speed and intensity. We have it set at "moderate" right in the middle and are sweating hard by the end of the workout. Would recommend!!
title: Great workout!

author: Maddey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
review_content: Love this game!!! For someone who wanted to make a change in their habits but is afraid of the gym, this is a life saver. I dabbled in wii fit back in the gap but this is a whole different realm- the fact that they show and reassure you how to execute the poses and keep correct form is ESSENTIAL to safe and proper exercise, especially for people with no experience! As well as there’s a lot more variety compared to what wii fit offered. I don’t want to spoil anything about the gameplay, but the fact that you stretch to warm up and cool down has helped me substantially, especially as an artist with poor posture/aches/etc. At times, especially if your difficulty is high you sure will know you’re exercising. But this game makes working out enjoyable and something to look forward to doing everyday! My only complaint is the leg strap, it’s a little difficult to make sure it stays in the same spot. I’d suggest investing in a pair of form fitting exercise pants to assure that it doesn’t slip, as wearing baggy sweatpants makes it very annoying! Besides that minor issue, it’s a lovely game that wants to help you improve your life, 5/5 would recommend to anyone with a switch!
title: A game that will change your life!

author: Krab Rangoon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2019
review_content: A decent fitness game for someone who does not work out or is trying to get into shape. This game provides an easy way to break a sweat while in the comfort of your home. If you plan on chasing gains or getting swole, purchase a gym membership or actual weights.I purchased this game for my wife, and she enjoys it. I gave the game a try, and it was surprisingly challenging. There are plenty of exercises in the campaign and minigames. You can also adjust the difficulty. However, don't think I would reccomend the game for small children. Some of the exercises might be difficult for someone with minimal coordination and no attention span.Workouts we have seen so far range from variations of crunches, jogging in place, and light chest/back exercises. This game could also help with increasing balance. I was also surprised at how well the sensor work together.While a fitness enthusiast might think this game is cringy, Ring Fit Adventure definitely exceeds my expectations.
title: Exceeded  expectations for a fitness game on Switch

author: Kalvin Connor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
review_content: When you think of the nintendo switch, you probably dont think of fitness game,sweating, and or combined with an rpg. What makes this game great is the rpg elements included in the game. They game "gameafys" getting to the next enemy/boss enough where you can enjoy your time running in place to get there. Its a well dine game that really has the ability to get you sweating as if you were in the gym if you go 100%.The only downfall of the game for me is that the variety of excersises to start is not large and the game is fairly repetitive until you unlock more abilities. However, since it is an rpg, you run into the issue that you probably want to carry AoE moves or hugh powered moves, rather than a variety of exercises again. I find myself doing the same 3-4 over and over again but still look forward to newer, stronger, attacks.
title: Fitness at home

author: Megan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: I have finished the game! I love this game. It is so fun to put together the fighting monsters and working out. I love running through the places. I always catch myself getting lost in the game and not even notices that I have ran 5 miles or that I have done over 300 squats. The game doesn't really get you super fit but it does keep you moving. I didn't sweat as much as I would have wanted but it is a much better alternative to sitting down and watching TV. I think it is a great game that keeps you active and wanting to play. I played this game everyday for weeks. It is engaging and entertaining.
title: Love this!

author: Jenn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2021
review_content: It’s pretty much the only exercise since the pandemic started that has stuck around for me. I am busy, so I just try to fit it in my schedule whenever I can. The storyline can be a little corny, but I adore it and it’s honestly really great for what it is. Ring fit is highly motivating to exercise and get reps in while trying to defeat the villains. I typically sweat when I play. There was only once when I didn’t and that was because I took it really easy that day. I do get sore the next day.
title: Great motivation

author: Kikko
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: This game has everything needed for players from all backgrounds to use.I am a fairly big guy so the leg strap fits and it is stretchable. It is very fun yet also fulfilling for exercising. I aim at least 30 mins everyday and there’s tons to do besides the main story.If you have a bad shoulder or weak knees, the game can implement “Body Assist” feature like Knee Assist to help you help enjoy/exercise the game to your full potential without putting focus on your knees or other body part.
title: Great for All Sizes/Age

author: Mike Padua
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020
review_content: With all that is going on right now, staying busy and physically fit is a bit more difficult. I needed a jump start since I have been lazy with everything shut down. Since I have been playing video games to keep me busy, I figured it was a good way to stay in shape too! This game did not disappoint. I thought it would be easy, but once I turned up the difficulty it got serious. I have not done so many squats in a row in my life, and as more exercises came the range of motion made the game more fun. I would recommend this game to anyone that wants to get active.
title: Great addition to keeping busy at home

author: Aurora Woodham
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2019
review_content: Graphics and story line for this game are good yet the workout it gives you is more than expected. Has a lot of exercises for specific muscle areas or can use the adventure mode to enjoy the game aspect. The leg strap does tend to slide on clothes however so needs to be on bare skin yet the game is so engaging it deserves all 5 stars. Even includes a mode to gain prizes while watching TV by doing ring squeezes.
title: Amazing workout

author: Vickie A. Cannon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
review_content: I got this for my kids for Christmas.  They have used it practically every day since - sometimes twice a day.  They like the challenge of the games, and they use the non-game section to target areas where they want to work on strength or flexibility.  I was pretty happy to see my gamer-kids to take an interest in fitness.  I've used it myself a few times, and the games really do distract you enough to keep you moving.  I will be playing again myself - and I hardly ever exercise.
title: It gets you moving, and you don't even realize how much

author: Lynette Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
review_content: This is the first fitness game I've seen that successfully pulls off both of those words. Fitness. Game.As far as fitness: itll kick your butt with the workouts and very customized to give you desired difficulty (not just easy medium hard.  You can really fine tune it).The game: dont get me wrong. Not saying its skyrim or anything.  The game is really a game. There are worlds with multiple stages in each with various obstacles.  Run through water, up stars, conveyor belts both forward and backward.  Potions for various stars. Skills when you level up. Gear. Single target attacks. Area of effect attacks. Elemental advantages/disadvantages per skill.I was skeptical when I first heard of this but the positive reviews convinced me to give it a shot. 10/10
title: Ground breaking

author: Jonathon D Leszczynski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020
review_content: VERY POOR setup for game.  It should let you choose which person is playing BEFORE configuring the controls or going over the videos.  Getting past the videos is a mystery.  I have no idea how it happened.  The game is also full of impossible to notice visuals that you won't see until you pass by and there is no way to turn around.Using the ring (compressing or stretching) is a cool idea, but not very useful for folks who are in good strength.  Further, you won't be able to play this easily in your basement with a drop ceiling.
title: Probably fine for people without much exercise history

author: Michael Jung
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
review_content: Finally was able to get this at the retail price after weeks of searching.Fun, addicting game that actually makes me want to move and exercise during this COVID Pandemic when we have to stay indoors.My friend has this so we are competing with each other unofficially.Definitely worth the price because it comes with the accessories.The retail price of this game is $79.99 USD when in stock by Amazon and Nintendo.Be wary of 3rd party sellers that sell this at a higher price.
title: Amazing

author: Roselanni Van Leishout
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2021
review_content: This game has been so fun! We have been playing for about a week and my 4 year old is obsessed! Even my 1 year old wants to play.Our daughter just turned four and she needed a lot of help the first couple times playing it, but now she can play on her own with minimal assistance and its so awesome to know she is having fun and getting in some exercise too!I wish this game had a multiplayer option, but other than that it is an excellent game and seriously makes fitness fun!
title: This game is awesome!

author: Rylee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
