review_content: I am someone who used to exercise regularly pre-covid. Then when I started working from home, it became hard for me to find a reason to exercise. I saw someone play this and it looked fun so I bought it and.. CAN'T RECOMMEND HIGHLY ENOUGH. I absolutely love it. I have exercised everyday since I got it!! I love love love it!
title: Love love love!!

author: CYGAGET
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: Ring Fit Adventure has met and exceeded my expectations.  The app is fun, funny, engaging, and provides a good workout (if you put in the effort and listen and follow the instructions).  In app instructions have helped me improve my posture for several yoga poses (especially chair pose).  Integrating RFA in to my daily exercise routine feels doable.  I can’t wait to learn how to navigate the app and set up custom total body routines I can use to add variety to my exercise tool box. RFA has shown me that despite being kind of strong , my flexibility is really needs work.  RFA along with my Wii Fit (yes I still have it) should help me get that 30 minutes of exercise I need most days of the week.  Dragaux and Ring characters are a little corny, but they keep me laughing.  I also go to a workout studio and do an hour long HIIT workout 2 days a week.  My guess is that using RFA on a regular basis is going to help me get more out of that studio workout.  I like RFA a lot!
title: I Like RFA

author: Kathy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_content: The Ring Fit is definitely a workout! My boyfriend works out at the gym 4-5 days a week and he chose the most challenging mode for his game profile, which had him sweating! He had to take a few breaks and call it a day half way through the first adventure, he also found the ring to be pretty strong/sturdy and it provides a good amount of resistance. I haven’t worked out in a long time, so I chose a less challenging mode for my profile, to ease my way back into it, and I was dripping in sweat by the end of the first adventure! Still trying to get used to using the ring for specific actions during the game, like “jumping,” but so far so good! Highly recommend for beginners and those who are more active!
title: Good workout for beginners and those who are more active!

author: Jessica
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2021
review_content: I really didn't think the game would give me a good workout, and the first few worlds had my heart rate up but seemed easy...and then I hit world five and the added exercises and wow it made a difference. I try to up my difficulty a little at a time after a couple of weeks and it makes a difference. I like that I can keep the workout short, not get yelled at for taking a day off, and my two year old likes to "play" it with me. It's great on its own, added to a routine for some variety, a starting point, or whatever works for you. I was surprised by how many of the muscle groups it works, sore after getting into the higher levels, and happy with the variety.
title: Surprising workout

author: bclaymier
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2021
review_content: I do mostly anaerobic exercises like lifting, climbing, etc. and picked this up to see if I could add it to my routines at home. I picked hard difficulty because I assumed it'd be EZPZ bs. The game made me feel like a fat, shapeless, idiot, impaled upon my hubris.10/10Must get fit.
title: This kicked my ass

author: Vanessa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020
review_content: Right out of the box one of the exercise "attacks" it asked me to do when fighting an enemy was something I literally could not do because of a lower back injury. The one where it asks you to lay on the floor and do leg curls. Oof. Once I selected it and realised I couldn't do it there was no way at all to cancel out or give up short of closing and rebooting the whole game. But I unlocked more moves pretty quick and never really had to do that one again. Been great since then.
title: Could be a bit more accessible but I still love it

author: General Shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021
review_content: I’ve been doing Ring Fit Adventures for 52 days spending 1 hour every morning. It provides some serious cardio exercises. It was hard at beginning but I felt difference day by day.According to my Apple Watch, the playing burns about 550 calories per hours. I’m now at level 150 and difficulty level 30 (the highest) I feel good after the exercise through the day
title: Fun game and serious exercise

author: ThatReviewGirl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
review_content: I did a lot of blogilates workouts in the past as well as some chloe ting workouts but it started to get really monotonous. I always found myself having to binge tv shows during my workouts so I could pass the time.Ring fit works for me because it gives me a goal that's more my personal health. It makes goals more attainable because there are actual monsters to fight in the game.I grew up playing MMORPGS like Maple Story so this just makes kinda like that 'cept my character is REALLY me.Love it.
title: Love this game!! It's a fun way to exercise.

author: K. Yagi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
review_content: Keep in mind this will not work with the Switch Lite.  You need the two detachable controllers.  I was worried that this is made for kids or smaller girls seen in the commercials, but it's a pretty tough workout for a bigger guy like me. Instructions said to pull or push hard as I can and I was ready to break the plastic looking device, but nope!  held up fine.  Not only that, but I felt sore the next day so this definitely works!  Workout isn't fun, but this "sort of" makes it fun.  Great!  I recommend it!
title: Nintendo makes another great reason to own the Nintendo Switch

author: Indigo Skye
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
review_content: I was under the impression this would just be another video game that had the added benefit of getting up and moving around. Boy, was I wrong. This game is good for anyone who wants to not only move around move and begin a more active lifestyle, you can set the difficulty and get your heart rate up, sweat and even get tired from progressing in the game. The boss to me is hilarious as he is a play on the stereotypical muscle jock and is always working out. If you ever feel like you might have increased your difficulty too much you can always lower it again in the game settings. The dynamic stretch portion is also good to warm up, and the cool down is a nice feature as well. It's not what I expected but I am happy to have it now in my arsenal.
title: Not What I expected

author: Kie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2021
review_content: I am not a particularly big girl at 5'1" and 140 pounds. When both models are the epitome of fitness, however, it's difficult for people who are not thin to follow their forms during exercises. I can follow the on-screen prompts until the cows come home, but even with just a small belly in the way, I'm forced to wonder where my form is suffering because I can't imitate exactly what the model is doing. Aren't the out-of-shape meant to be this game's target audience? Isn't that what you're after when you make an exercise game? It's a little disappointing and I can't recommend the game to anyone much bigger than me in good faith.
title: This is all great, but where do I put my fat?

author: Bren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2019
review_content: First of all, the story mode in this game is just charming and fun.  The music is great and the atmosphere is beautiful.  The exercises themselves are heart-pounding workouts that will not just make you lose weight, but build muscle.  The issue with Wii Fit was that there was no real resistance training.  The ring provides that resistance and in an easy to learn but difficult to master way.  I've only been playing for a half hour and I'm sweating!  Great game, highly recommended for anyone who wants to work out and have a blast doing it.
title: Like Wii Fit, but 10 times better!

author: Ted Nitz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
review_content: Just got this on Thursday. I work a desk job and wasn’t in shape pre Covid, and Covid made it much worse. Now I am sore from exercising. This game has me moving in ways I never would on my own. It’s reasonably fun to play and it really motivates you to try hard.As a major perk my 4 year old absolutely loves it. He has played far more then me. He needs a little help understanding some of the combat exercises but he talks about exercising all the time and wants to play more then he wants to watch IPad.
title: Fun for kids and adults

author: Sienna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019
review_content: My husband seldom plays video games nor working out, on top of that he does not enjoy spending money on leisure activities. But he becomes interested in them when he watched some review videos and after this arrived he watches me play in the first few days, then he joined me for some mini-games. He loves it! This game completely changed his mind on games and working out and he was so happy to spend money on this game. I love this game too, it makes working out so much fun! I love the stretching part too! I can't wait to invite my friends come and play with us!
title: Great game!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2021
review_content: What can I say if working out is new for you this game will kick your ars.  You play a game which keeps your mind off the actual working out until you wake up two days later and think what truck ran me over last night.  Its legit a great workout in the privacy of your home.
title: Best workout and lots if fun!!

author: Klink
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020
review_content: I've been using video games to keep fit since the the Nintendo Wii release. This is a great addition to the series. I think it's an improvement for upper body strength and overall strength conditioning. Not as good for cardiovascular exercise and lower body stuff than Wii Fit. I do like having a game mode to play through. Although it can take longer to get to work out. Overall I'm happy to see Nintendo stick with fitness gaming. This is definitely a worthy addition to my fitness library.
title: Great addition to Nintendo's fitness game library

author: Corey T. Williams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: I've been a Nintendo fan for most of my life. I was excited when the Wii fit board came out. I was disappointed when I was way to heavy to use it. When I saw the switch had something similar I was like that looks like something I can do. I was worried that the leg strap wouldn't fit my big leg, so I bought some extra leg straps I thought would be longer. Too my surprise the one that came with it fit the best. It does slide down your leg some while running in place but not that bad. I have played a few mini games that are way fun and the adventure. I must say this is a very fun way to exercise. I love it.
title: Great even for 6'5 460 lbs man!

author: Sif
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021
review_content: Nintendo does it again. They created an amazing product. It's intuitive, easy to learn, and interactive. The music and game modes are great. It's a lot more fun playing with other people. If you have a treadmill, it makes the game even more amazing. 100/10 would recommend
title: Simple, Entertaining, Effective

author: K. Goode
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021
review_content: This has been great to help get the kids moving while school is mostly virtual.  Their PE teacher has been great with ideas but this got the kids really moving.  I wish more players could use this at once.  But we have enjoyed this game.  It is also easy to set up and adjust for difficulty so it is not intimidating.
title: Great to get you moving

author: John
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2019
review_content: I’m really enjoying this. I found myself working out for an hour to complete a quest and drenched in sweat. I can already see major changes, my stomach has flattened out and my arms and legs have a lot more definition. This product solves the tediousness of working out with a fun friendly game that you exercise in. I hope they make more content for it.The gameplay isn’t the most involved, but it’s approachable and does the job. The characters are zany and likable. The controls are easy to handle. There’s a ton to like here.
title: Fun game solves workout boredom

author: Soundman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
review_content: Great fitness program for when you’re stuck inside or don’t want to pay for the gym. You can tailor the exercises to your liking. The whole family loves it. Don’t go crazy paying scalper prices though. It should be ~$70.
title: Great exercise when you’re stuck inside!

author: Jessie Marlow
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
review_content: I'm a person who loves to work out and enjoys physical activity but I get bored easily! Sports are usually how I get exercise, but do to covid those are unfortunately few and far between. Jogging was so boring and hard to commit to until I got this. I'm athletic and in shape so I was skeptical that It'd be a good fit for me, but the difficulty setting gets intense! I'm on level 25 out of 30 and find it rigorous. It's easily customizable for however I want to work out and I look forward to my workouts. The only downside is it's not two player, or else I'd grab a friend and compete!
title: This game rocks!

author: Sarah M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
review_content: First of all, I hated wii fit. This game is nothing like it. The ring itself is legit. It is sturdy, has nice soft hand grips and handles very well. The leg strap is nice too. For me I have to re-adjust it a bit, but it might be because I'm very fat. I've only done the first level, I did it on the easiest setting and it was hard. I sweat buckets. I can imagine it could get a tiny person in shape. My 4 year old had fun playing it. I'm not super excited to do level 2 because I hate fitness. But I will definitely continue to do it every other day. I will write an update if I can stay committed!
title: I'm very fat. But I'll keep using it!

author: M F
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
review_content: I and my husband both have creative jobs, and you know that means: we don't go outside nor do workouts.So i got the ringfit for both of us and we have been "playing" this game since the beginning of this year.15-20mins/ a day3-4 times/weekwe really didn't change our dietand my husband who used to hate workouts loves this game and actually lost more than 15lb in 2.5 months. and i really gained stamina and muscle meanwhile.This is really a fun and well-made game: having a variety of workouts and gradually changing difficulty which helps us continue working out.Also, now we have to stay home all the time. Ringfit really helps us relieve some stress and keep us sane.

author: Nyta
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021
review_content: This is a great game. It definitely gets you up and moving. It takes you through different obstacles courses and a variety of exercises to accomplish goals and beat enemies. 30 minutes of this everyday will keep you or your kiddos active. The only down side is I paid 10.00 bucks more for this online then in a store right down the street from my house. That's P's me off. Stop jacking up prices.. Other then that, we enjoy the game.
title: Very interactive game. Love it

author: Hollie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020
review_content: So much fun but you feel it the next day. I've used this a few days in a row now and I actually feel like I've had a good workout when I'm done and I'm actually a little sore the next day. I was excited to find this, I loved my WII Fit and have been trying to find this game for a year now, was so happy when it was finally back in stock. I have really enjoyed using the Ring Fit, hope Nintendo comes out with more games for the Ring!
title: Fun and a Workout

author: Jeremy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2021
review_content: I normally stick to weights in the gym since I prefer to do cardio outside of the gym, but due to the pandemic I've been staying inside a lot. I decided to get this game to change things up a bit and make working out a little different, and it really is an adventure! The game never feels boring, it's challenging enough, and also gives plenty of reminders to stop when it thinks you've done enough for the day. Highly recommend!
title: Doesn't feel like cardio!

author: Kenji Hobbs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: Highly effective workouts. The gameplay is a fun twist on RPGs. You can craft smoothies, acquire fitness clothes with status buffs, explore enemy weaknesses with different exercise types, and switch out your moveset easily.I bought this game to help get back on track with my exercise. What I found was a genuinely enjoyable world and characters, fun elements of platforming, adventure, and RPG games, and a comprehensive workout program. AND minigames. AND regular fitness routines. Worth the cover price all the way.
title: Fun!

author: Lauren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
review_content: I wasn't entirely sure what to expect when we got this game. It is the most fun I've had exercising in a really long time. Ring Fit Adventure is the perfect way to exercise for gamers. As I continue to play the more things I unlock in the game and it's a great motivator. This is the first exercise game (other than maybe the Just Dance series) where I actually get excited to get home and play it. Must have for anyone looking to exercise while gaming.
title: SO FUN!

author: cakefish
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2021
review_content: Interesting gamifying the exercise experience! There are a ton of playthrough videos to see if you’d enjoy it. I did enjoy the mini games but be warned if you live in an apartment, there’s a lot of running in place (though there is an option to prevent this). Also seems like you can remove the pads, etc. to wash which is great considering workout = sweat. Ended up returning because I just realized I’d rather other methods for exercising but might work well for you!
title: Interesting experience

author: Kaay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
review_content: Nintendo was on onto something when they made Wii Fit almost 13 years ago. The science and work that went into this game makes you appreciate them as a game company. You ACTUALLY feel the burn and get a work out while playing a video game. Or if you dont want to play story mode (Not sure why you wouldn't as grinding levels in this rpg only helps you work out more) there's a causal work out mode that let's pick the areas of the body you want to work out.
title: Work out Role Playing Game

author: Hunter Meredith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019
review_content: So far I’ve only been playing adventure mode and I have loved every minute. My main workout routine is just running and this is good to continue building cardio endurance while toning muscle. I feel this is very similar to the BeachBody Insanity workout with Shaun T. During battle I’m hearing him in my head along with the Ring character telling me how to better correct my form.The game does a great job of engaging you and is surprisingly accurate at tracking your movements through the forms. It waits to begin a set when you’re in the proper posture and I’ve really enjoyed the variety in movements to pass through the levels.I definitely plan on keeping this a part of my daily workout and am extremely glad for the impulse buy. Can’t wait to see what more Nintendo does with this type of concept.
title: Good sweat!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2021
review_content: I was worried the programs wouldn't be challenging enough or that the plot of the game would be too gimicky, but the workouts are tailored to your skill level and the exercises you do are varied. I love that, when in a battle, you get the chance to pick which stretch/workout you'd like to do next so that you can either power through or give your legs a break as you need to. The variety of workouts is constantly building and it feels like a genuine accomplishment when you get through a level - it's definitely helped me stay active while stuck inside and it never feels like a chore to start working out!
title: Motivating and Fun!

author: Daniel Dittman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2020
review_content: This great fitness tool for sure .  After the first level on casual I was sweating and heart was pumping.  Its welcome to people who want to legit exercise .  Its not a  gimmick and great deal if you can get at retail price and not the dishonest resellers that buy it out underneath you with their bots,  I try to order this several times but bots stop my purchase and then the inventory was gone.  When I got for retail price it was a relief.
title: Awesome

author: Vance Valerio
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: Nintendo really nailed it with this one. Taking the learns from wii fit it’s awesome to see how far fitness games have come this decade. It’s fun, silly and un-intimidating while getting in a great resistance training/full body work out. Way easier to motive myself to play this for 30 minutes than drive to the gym. I really like the adventure mode where each rep turns into an attack on enemies. Really makes you want to push yourself!
title: A lot of fun and a good workout!

author: Brittney5920
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
review_content: I absolutely love this game! It is always a really fun and, on top of that, IT’S A WORKOUT! I always end up sweating after each session or during story mode. There are several ways to have fun. There is story mode, custom workout, rhythm game workout, and even a mode where you just do reps with the ring-con to gain prizes! You can also choose how difficult you want the game to be. It ranges from intense to casual. The heart race sensor is also quite accurate. I give this game a 5 stars for kids and adults.
title: Amazing and quite an exercise!

author: Lexie Archer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
review_content: Everything came in a big plastic bag, no box. Ring con, leg strap, and game case. I opened the game case up and VOILA! NO GAME.
title: Everything Came Super Sketchy

author: Mia G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: As a work-at-home employee, I don't leave home really and sit way too much. This means I have negative motivation to go to the gym. This game is like the perfect solution. It doesn't take a whole lot for me to want to play a game, and this one is very cute and light so its also a de-stresser. I get a nice workout every time, and love that I can set my difficulty level and determine which exercises I want to really hone in on.BONUSES!-Tracks your heart rate periodically-Lets you know how many calories you've burned-Keeps track of your physical progress, not just game progressLove this, 5/5 from my lazy butt
title: 5/5 From This Lazy Lady

author: Ewok
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
review_content: I hate exercising, nothing about it is fun for me. Being able to gamify it and get direct feedback about what I'm doing right and wrong is super helpful. I've done it everyday for 2 weeks now and its making a difference. The ring controller is a surprisingly effective workout tool. Some of the moves absolutely wear me out! The game has a lot of depth with enemy types, modes, and activities to keep your attention.  Highly recommend!
title: Love this game!

author: Jenna Crispi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021
review_content: I got this in mid February and I have used it almost everyday for at least 30 minutes.  It's amazing because I'm usually not that motivated to exercise.  The story world is fun and it's nice to think you're moving towards a visible goal, definitely helps with the motivation, but one of the best features about this game is custom mode.  Making different playlists depending on the day is a great way to keep going. Some days I like to do a full segment of exercises targeting different areas, some days I just want to do a bunch of jogging, and when I'm not interested in exercising the minigames give a light workout while not seeming like exercise at all.I've already lost around 10 lbs and over an inch from my waist, and I haven't really changed any of my other habits.  So happy I bought this
title: Great way to start exercising

author: Arasin Hughes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2020
review_content: I was an extreme skeptic on this game for quite awhile - I had looked at it in stores around the holidays and thought it was too expensive for something that would be played once and tossed aside. I LOVE this game! I have never been into working out and this has helped me be motivated enough to get into a routine of healthy improvements. Some things really kick my butt and it impressed me! I’m intrigued to see where the story line goes - I tried the quick mode with work outs and realized I should step up my adventure difficulty to be able to do the quick reps it was asking! If you’re looking for something out of the norm if you’re not a typical work out person like me - do it!The ONLY critique I currently have is I wish there was a two player mode for partner workouts and the like. Possibly an idea for developers in the future!
title: Stop second guessing and buy it!

author: Clarissa Mancilla
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
review_content: grab this now!, its on sale on amazon only $69, i paid $88 total just a few weeks ago and this was sold out pretty much all of 2020 and was as much as $200 on ebayI cant get to the gym, so this is a fun way to get my work out on. i'm a casual gamer and i still had fun with this and im almost 50 years old, i wish i had started this earlier, but better late than never and a cool birthday gift for myselfi suggest a workout mat, water bottle and sweat band or towel.heart rate monitor on this is pretty accurate. lots of fun exercises you can do, or play the story mode of the game
title: this game is no joke, you will be drenched in sweat

author: Kalcaman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
review_content: I'd say this is a great game for those who don't workout very much or are new to exercise.My wife and I purchased this in order to give us a way to make at home workouts fun.While I workout and weight-lift I also find this a great way to boost my heart rate and have fun at the same time!Nice added daily cardio and the difficulty scales super well. We haven't beaten the main story mission so far but it's so far shown so much promise.  The RPG elements of the adventure mode are also super fun!
title: Great mix of aerobics and muscular exercise in a fun game package

author: Katie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021
review_content: Got this to help me lose some weight and while it's fun (if a bit cheesy) it's not for the weak of knee. It's actually a decently intense work out (I'm out of shape so take that with a grain of salt). I was hoping I could have more control over the workout but it's pretty locked in early on and I don't have the knee-strength to get to where I can change it. Still a good purchase, I'm not mad in the slightest.
title: Fun if you have good knees

author: R. Clancy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2021
review_content: I rarely write reviews but this game is amazing!!! I normally ride my bike and/or Peloton which is good cardio, but it doesn’t work other muscles.  I picked this up for my husband for Christmas and I have been using it 5-6 times a week ever since.  It’s a silly game but I really enjoy it and I’m definitely using muscles that have been neglected for awhile.  I’m 40, in pretty good shape and I’m on level 19, if that helps anyone.  The game makes it very easy to change the difficulty level if it’s too hard or too easy.  This is a surprisingly great product and I highly recommend it to anyone.  My 3 kids enjoy it, too.
title: This is an amazing product!!

author: Daybidcho
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2021
review_content: It is very rare to find a game that you can exercise your whole body with.The people at Nintendo are so creative and talented for making exerciseso fun with this game.  What's even better is that this game is great for all ages,even adults, as my wife and I love taking turns playing the game and cheering each other on.I highly recommend this if you or your kids need exercise.
title: Great way to exercise while having fun!

author: Laird Popkin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2019
review_content: Great fun, and a pretty good workout. They get me so caught up in playing the game that I get a workout every day, because it’s fun! It’s cheaper than a gym membership that you never go to.
title: Fun = motivation

author: Nghi Tu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
review_content: This game is simply amazing!!! I hate exercise and haven't done so in years. Thought this was where I should start. Add to that, it doesn't help focus on posture or remind you to take breaks, so the next day I felt tired when exercise was supposed to make me feel more energetic. I eventually stopped using them and went back to layng down or sitting all day.This game makes me feel energetic and more positive. You can also adjust difficulty level if it's too hard or too easy. This made me sweat and I went from 0 min of exercise to at least half an hour. Now I can't wait to do my next exercise session tomorrow! Definitely recommend getting it if you hate exercise and want to get into it or just to keep up reps.

author: Sarah

title: Addicting, fun, and a great workout!

author: Liza Simmons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2021

Its a blast and a great find.
title: It's really fun

author: ChiBiChi

title: Wish It got me to work out more

author: It’s summer 🏊‍♀️🌅🍦🏖😎

She loves to play the game practically every day, and I must say I don’t mind it at all!
title: Amazing Fitness Game

author: Spender
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020
review_content: I wasn’t sure this would be that good of a work out but It turned out I was wrong. It puts you through your paces. I really like the game type feature makes it more interesting and fun. You get constant feedback and instructions. It is even able to take your pulse for a more accurate evaluation of progress. You earn more exercises as you level up. And you can adjust the difficulty level up or down. All in all it’s fun and worthwhile.
title: Exercising fun in a game

author: Kristin N.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: I don’t exercise for the sake of exercise. Gyms give me anxiety, and I can’t run for very long. Since the salsa clubs closed, I hadn’t found a way to get intense exercise until I tried this. As I’m writing this, I’m thinking I’d rather be playing (getting a legit workout) because it’s fun and makes me feel good about myself. I have no doubt that COVID weight is going to melt away over the winter!
title: I hate exercise but love this game!

author: Karen Cylc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: I purchased this for my nine-year-old son for Christmas. He was able to use it, right out of the box. The game even told him how many calories he burned, which created a whole new conversation. I highly recommend it.

author: @RickNakama
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019

That won't be very entertaining after a few occurrences.
title: Very fun way to stay active & fit.

author: LT

title: Great strength training.

author: Jab

title: Wonderful exercise program for senior citizens.

author: Aubrie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020

I would get the switch again just for this game.
title: Most fun I have had working out

author: Alissa Glaeser

Other than that, great game!

I can push myself further with this game than I have ever been able to exercising in any other way.

title: No there isn’t anything that you should know but I think the price can go down a little bit

author: Briana

author: abby

While writing this review my son is on yet another adventure with Ring fit!

author: Talia Sturm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2021
review_content: I got this for my wife and I and we both love it. A few friends of mine ended up picking this up on my recommendation as well, and we've all had nothing but good things to say about it.
title: A fun exercise.

author: drew adams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020
review_content: Really fun game - it's as challenging as you want it to be. author: Cole Bieser
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2021

author: Star Akucewich

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021
review_content: This game tricks you into the fun experience but at the end you feel like you have gone to a Hitt body session love the esthetic and the way the ring and sensitivity of the controls capture all the movements also the heart rate is very accurate compared to my sports watch. Love the experience and hopefully I'll be able to achieve a better body with this game!
title: Great workout!

author: Masha
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020
review_content: Got this so me and my family could be more active. My ten year old brother tried it out first. He typically doesn't like being too physical and gets tired easily but he is so eager to do this game. After the first few times he said he was sore so yay it's working and it's fun! Great for when the winter is coming and harder to get out and be active outdoors.
title: A fun way to be active indoors!

author: Jonathan H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: I borrowed this game from a friend until I could buy my own, and it's been great! Game is enjoyable but challenging and you definitely work up a sweat. I appreciate how it calculates calories burnt, and keeps both daily and overall cumulatives to track your progress. So far, I've burnt over 9,500 calories, done over 3,000 squats, 20,000 ring presses, and ran 50 miles over the course of 30 hours of play time. I definitely am stronger, thinner, and have more endurance from this game.
title: Fantastic Workout Game!

author: Mika the Cat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
review_content: I really like this game, gets me to work out every day for 30 minutes per day, and plus, i love the mini games and competition with my wife. We strive to get stronger together and better than eachother as possible.I'm honestly very surprised by the resistance weight of the band and how it can be used. I hope other games end up using the resistance band in someway or another.
title: The Mini games are really fun.

author: Luongo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2021
review_content: It's so much fun and I'd play it every day if I could. Can't say I'm noticing a difference in my fitness level since I only play once a week, but I'd like to believe I'm maintaining my current level if nothing else (I can run after the bus, and that's all I really want). I actually don't know what I'm going to do once I finish it, maybe I'll replay it. Very good for exercising in these covid times.
title: You wouldn't expect this concept to work, but it does

author: Josh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
review_content: Ringcon
title: Siksjm

author: Kobusiinge
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021
review_content: We’ve had this for a few weeks and are already recommending it to all our Nintendo Switch friends. It makes exercising fun & you can set it to your own pace & endurance level. You can set up different profiles & compare scores with their minigames. I only wish they made an option so 2 people can play at once. I would buy the expansion if they did!
title: Great fun & gets you moving. Needs 2 player option.

author: S. Eden
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: My son who loves video games is right there with me exercising with this! He always beats me at video games and I’m more into exercise. We both love this! I used to ride my bicycle in the winter cold for exercise no longer! I like the variety of exercises too. It’s impressive how many muscle groups you can work with a ring and a leg strap. The ring seems very resilient. We have been using it for four days now with no signs of wear. We are both men and weight about 200lbs each.The leaderboard  both for workouts and strength games is motivating.
title: Love working out at home in the winter!

author: Tim S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: This game is great.  Our whole family plays it together one after another.  It really gets my heart pumping as well and I've even been sore for days after playing it a few times.  Good stuff!
title: Lots of fun.  Real workout.

author: Neeblet
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
review_content: I bought this game so that the family can have some exercise at home. We absolutely love it. It is an RPG style and motivating you to level up by exercise more.This game is very unique and my family highly recommend it.
title: Super fun and great way to excercise

author: Hansen Millett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
review_content: For someone who doesn't love to exercise, this is a great product! This game distracts me enough and is fun enough for me not to be thinking about the fact that I'm working out the entire time I'm working out. There are lots of elements about it that make me want to work harder! It's fun and has good health tips. It really focuses on taking care of yourself and not pushing yourself too hard. Super fun game. 10 out of 10.
title: 10 out of 10

author: Roger
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
review_content: I was not expecting to be hooked with this game. I thought it was going to be very simple. But it is not! I love how it uses your strength so it is specific to every person. It requires you to have better outfits that you buy with game currency you acquire in the levels. At first, I thought that outfits were just to look nice but they increase your attack and defense power.  I really liked it because it is not only effective to work out but it has elements of an RPG game where you need to upgrade your items in order to defeat bosses. I highly recommend it, it is a fun way to exercise if you love video games.
title: It gets you excited about working out!

author: NooN Rs4
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2020
review_content: Awesome Game & exercise.. I play along with my girl & son.Definitely a great game experience and if you do the right thing will totally work for you... Very sad that it is sold out everwhere & prices are insane now here on Amazon & Ebay. Most these games are being shipped to Europe and Asia since the Nintendo Switch is region free.
title: Great game experience

author: Amanda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2020
review_content: Took longer to come than expected and was showing delivered for days before it actually was BUT it was worth the wait. Used it once for 5 minutes on silent mode and the next day my legs where sore from all the squatting! Perfect for me since I live on the 3rd floor! Good in home workout for the whole family...
title: Good workout, good for small apartments even 3rd floor with silent mode

author: Sambick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020
review_content: Wife never ever exercise... ever... She said she was one of those girls who sat on the side for gym class through her elementary -> high school days. She loves this. Spends 30-45 min everyday. Her body was having a hard time initially but the more she plays the higher the difficulty she is making it. Making a difference to her body both physically and mentally. great thing.
title: Wife and Kids play this every other day

author: Matt Dietzenbach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021
review_content: This game is so much fun way to exercise.  You can do so many different exercise routines with in the program itself.  There is an adventure mode game play that is fun for all ages.  There are multiple settings for your athletic ability, so anyone can play.  I recommend it for anyone that wants to try a different way of exercising.
title: Great Fun!

author: Orange Blaze
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2021
review_content: I really enjoyed the old Wii Fit with the balance board, and found those games fun. This was nowhere like that experience for me. I find the entire interface unappealing and the mini-games dull. The "Adventure" was equally as bad. I wanted to have fun while working out, and this is not that! Tried to return product, but don't have a free drop off anywhere near my house unfortunately. What a waste!
title: Not as fun as the old Wii Fit!

author: Courtney Popp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021
review_content: There are so many cool features in this game, and all lead to you having a good workout while having fun! The story line of the game is a bit cheesy, but I'm sure kids would like that part the best. You can choose your workout level and change whenever you want, you can take a break from following the game and play some mini games that target specific parts of your body, do mini jog sessions through the lands from the game, and there's even dance type workout games you can play too! Overall, I really enjoy this game to break up the monotony that is circuit workouts.
title: Fun workout game!

author: Jessica
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2021
review_content: I don't exercise.Like, ever.I want to become healthier and more active, so I thought this would be a easy way to do that.It whooped my ass.I was sweating and sore.I might have pushed myself a little too hard, but the game is genuinely so fun to play, I didn't realize how hard I was working.The adventure mode is engaging.The mini games were great for playing with my friends.My husband loved the rythym games.Everyone got enjoyment out of it.If you have a Switch, this is a must have.
title: Kicked my ass!

author: Wendy F
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020
review_content: I have been playing with the ring for a month and finally feel that I have some experience to talk about.The toy is easy to set up. Not sometimes I have to reconnect the right consoles.  The plot is simple and repetitive: controlling an avatar to move to beat monsters, complete different trails and play games. It is good enough to keep me from backing to my old sedative life.  The work out looks well thought of. Each section lasts 5-7 minutes with cardio, strength and stretch.
title: Keep me going

author: Patricia Martin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021
review_content: This game is so much fun. I am terrible at working out and this game makes it fun. Mind you, I have only been playing for 3 days, but I am starting to notice a difference in how I am feeling. I also love that it keeps track of the estimated calories burned and distance run. I highly recommend this for anyone who struggles with finding the motivation to work out. Great game. I will update as I get more into the game and start noticing physical changes.
title: Great game for anyone who doesn't like working out.

author: Shannon Fields
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2021
review_content: I was immediately smitten with this game. I have a hard time being motivated to exercise and due to the pandemic my work environment changed drastically from an incredibly mobile position to being seated for most of the day. Additionally, any hopes of going to the gym were quashed through my unwillingness to go to the gym plus the need to social distance. The format of the game uses adventure and point earning to give you immediate satisfaction in seeing results. I'm always trying to get a high score! The adventure is fun if not a bit cheesy and you get a well-rounded workout without feeling overwhelmed by the idea of exercise. Perfect for the person who'd like to exercise more but absolutely hates traditional exercise - like me! XD
title: No Regrets! 100% would buy again

author: summerjo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
review_content: I am not one to normally write reviews but just like others have said, this is awesome! We got it because both my husband and I have been trying to work out more but have been bored of the things we have been doing. In the 24 hours we have done it we have already worked out twice. Even our five year old has beat the first world. I can tell this is going to be a family favorite! I have already told a bunch of friends about it and will continue to do so. Highly recommend!
title: Awesome, even for kids!

author: lbjsall
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021
review_content: Anyone remember Temple Run? Its like the live version of that mixed with something akin to knock off Pokémon. This game is so awesome! Its so fun and distracts you from the fact that you're exercising. If you are thinking about getting it just do it! I promise you won't regret it. I detracted a star because the leg band is hard to adjust right. Either its cutting off circulation or its sliding down your leg.
title: BUY IT NOW

author: Krystal Rainz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2021
review_content: I have had my eye on this and decided to buy it after a few months of my at home work out not working as much as Id like it to. A few minutes of this game and I feel more of a burn than just dance and my home bike combined!!!!
title: What a work out

author: GMcSween
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
review_content: Best money I’ve spent in awhile. Went from a sedentary lifestyle to an active and healthy lifestyle. So helpful walking you through the exercises and the game is addicting (especially with the added exercise endorphins). Leveled up past 100 and still enjoying it. My weight has stayed exactly the same but I’ve noticeably swapped fat for muscle which is a first for me. I’m less fatigued and feel more confident. We’ve also been eating better as a family probably due to all of the healthy tips and smoothie-making in the game! I hope they make a new one with a new storyline and maps soon!!
title: Swap fat for muscle in your living room

author: Alysha W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
review_content: I was skeptical at first at all of the 5-star reviews but after trying it for myself, it is sooooo much fun! You can work out only or play the game while working out. It makes your workout fun while you're being active. Since I have started using it (at least 30 min/day), I have gradually lost weight while targeting the areas that I want to work on. I have had my 12 year daughter try it as well and she enjoys it too! It has become my regular workout regime! Give it a try! I don't think you'll be disappointed!
title: Lots of fun!!!

author: Cristy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2020
review_content: Easy to modify exercises or avoid ones that are painful. Every session starts with a quiz about difficulty.Also- every session asks you to start with dynamic stretches (you can skip) and ends with static stretches (also skipable). Cool bit being the static stretches vary based on what exercises you have done.I have a neck muscle injury and stretches are my most reliable pain management. Nice to randomly learn new ones that might help avert pain, neck or otherwise.
title: Pretty fun

author: testa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021
review_content: I don’t want to give unrealistic expectations, but our whole household has seen results from playing this game. The fitness levels ranged from postpartum couch potato to regular gym-goer. It kicks all our butts but is so much fun. We’ve all lost weight and I’ve been playing for over a month now. Get this game as part of your exercise regimen!
title: Great Purchase!

author: Play piano
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
review_content: So far I enjoy it. Playing this before I play any of my sedentary games keeps me in a good mood and gives me increased focus. However, I ring’s voice is SO annoying. I’m thankful that you can turn it off... but it would have been nice to have been voice acting and scripting for the ring since you have to heard it all the time.
title: Good game, annoying ring voice

author: Grey Singleton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: Calisthenics + Resistance training + Yoga. A great combination. This is Wii Fit on Acid. The RPG mechanics may be a bit simplified, but what's unique is how it so beautifully game-ifies fitness. Huge game with over 20 worlds, will likely take you months to clear the main campaign. It can be as challenging as you want it to be. And yes, everyday is leg day in Ring Fit Adventure, but it encourages you to work all your muscle groups. Truly a unique and fun experience. Best fitness game on the market.
title: RFA is the real deal and fun to boot

author: Diogmites
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
review_content: This game has motivated me to work out on a daily basis which is unprecedented. It’s a fun light RPG with plenty of customization both in terms of charcoal aesthetics and workout variation. Who knew boss battles could get me to do squats? Highly recommended to gamers who want to have a legit reason to exercise.
title: I loathe working out but RingFit is fun!

author: Erick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2019
review_content: Absolutely LOVE this! I was a bit skeptical on how good the workouts would be but in all honesty, this game will kick your butt while you're having a blast playing it!
title: Great fun and a great workout!

author: Invisible Mother
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
review_content: Love this exercise game for the Nintendo Switch. Really gets your body moving and working and at the same time enjoying a game.This is way better than the wii fit my husband says.If you want something to help get your body moving without going to the gym all the time, this is for you.
title: Definitely Worth it Purchase!

author: Lisa Holloway
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
review_content: Three family members have tried it and all finished playing this game tired and sore but best yet, had fun while exercising.  The ring is really sturdy.  Despite having to put all your strength into it, it feels like it will last a really long time.  I'm very impressed with the design and the variety of exercises you can do with a simple ring.  The ring can even check your heart rate.  The game play reminds me of a mixture of Mario and Legend of Zelda.  You can get matching outfit accessories that make your attacks stronger against the monsters.  I find I want to keep on playing but my body hasn't caught up yet.  I sometimes need to take a day in between to rest.  The mini games would be great to play at a party.
title: A real challenge

author: Produce Queen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020
review_content: Wow. I didn’t think this would really work your body out. I was surprised. It takes a while to set up and calibrate but once you get it, it’s pretty fun.
title: Great work out

author: Jeff Garland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
review_content: My wife wanted this for Christmas so my boys got it for her.  She loves it.  Says doing it is more like an adventure game than exercising although she was pretty sore after she did it two days in a row.  It may get old eventually but so far she has been playing it a lot since Christmas and really likes it.
title: We like it

author: Doyles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020
review_content: What a smart idea and well executed product. Never would have thought I’d want to play through an RPG and helps me stay active and lose weight. While it is a commitment to workout this game makes it easier to stay committed because you’re gaining in-game experience and rewards as well as in- real life gains too.
title: Super fun workout!

author: bridgecross
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
review_content: This is NOT like the old Wii fitness motion tracker.  The gyros in the controllers, in conjunction with the resistance ring, really track your body movement.  And the exercise-driven goals of the game are really addictive.  We've got the whole family fighting over who get to exercise next.  Highly recommended.
title: Both a fun game and very real fitness benefits.

author: Caseyfolks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: I never had time to exercise but I always had time to play my favorite video games for 20 to 30 minutes.  This game will become your favorite video game and those 20 to 30 minutes will become your workout!The game itself is fairly reasonable, but the Nintendo Switch can be a little pricey at $299.00. You can share with your kid, but you may end up hogging the Switch for yourself.The courses get progressively harder, but that is how you become more fit.  Some days the game kicks my butt, but you can control the intensity and after a month, I find that I have more stamina and my clothes are loosening up a hair, even though my scale doesn't see the movement of fat loss and muscle gain.Find a friend to train with and it doubles the fun!
title: Get fit even if you don't have time!

author: C. Campbell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2021
review_content: I’ve been using this every day for the last week and I feel like I look forward to exercise for the fist time in my life. This thing is no joke though. 30mins has me sweating buckets.I hope they make a whole bunch of games to go with it. Maybe a sci-fi one next, or a horror one where you’re running from zombies!

author: Cassandra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
review_content: I just got this game today and I absolutely love it. Most times when I’m working out I think, ‘Oh, how much longer until this misery is over?’ With this game, I was so distracted by what the characters were doing on screen that I forgot I was working out and wanted to keep pushing to see what would happen next. I’m sure it can get repetitive after a while, but the distraction is great!
title: So fun you don’t know you’re working out!

author: Benjamin Cobb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021
review_content: I very much like this game and it is a good way to be active, however, my biggest complaint is that the leg strap falls down all the time. I have to look up other means to keep it in place, but for the most part, I wear it around my knee more that anything, if not my ankle. That part is annoying. Overall very great.
title: Really Fun! BUT

author: Franchesca Vega
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: After being at home for so long and not having space to buy the right equipment for exercise, I decided to buy this game. If you are looking for a game that will be fun and help your health as well.
title: This game is crazy good

author: Tarzan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: This is fantastic for the winter, I’ll still do it in the summer but this will tug on your brain that you know you want to do it and keep with it. Been doing it for 2 months and have seen differences in my body.

author: Elane Wright
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2021
review_content: Great game for all ages my 6 yr old loves it more than me and I’m happy with it. My only issue is the ab guard move always take health away and it’s frustrating. It’s a good cardio and strength training workout.
title: Great game and workout!

author: Dean D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
review_content: I loved the original Wii fit and was constantly impressed by how much Nintendo is able to do with so little (like they packed a LOT of fun in to that board!). The Ring Fit is similar in terms of how much fun they can create with just a ring and a few sensors. Really happy with my purchase.
title: The kind of fun and quality you expect from Nintendo

author: Piper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021
review_content: When I’m not doing my part time retail job, i just sit around doing my online classes for college. This switch game though will really kick your ass and its enjoyable without being bored out of your mind. It gave me flashbacks to wii fit that i used to use as a kid. Its a pretty good work out if your like me and are a lazy student or who sits in front of a computer all day.
title: Worth It

author: Jason C Howes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020

author: Riko
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020

author: Justin G Lewandowski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2021

author: Koweechee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020
review_content: With Covid & smoke forcing us to stay indoor at home, this was a perfect game to stay (close to) being fit. author: Amazon Customer

author: Relle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021

title: So much fun!

author: Cityboy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021
review_content: Way better than we could have expected! Our kids that were getting really out of shape during quarantine have benefited so much from the physical activity.  While they would never agree to do yoga or calisthenics- they love the gamification of these intense activities.  It’s a great buy.
title: The only video game we encourage :)

author: Casey Reed
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2020
review_content: I have only used it one day but it was fun and it makes me want to play more.I seriously hope they make more games like this.I actually feel like I worked out.The game is cheesy but I actually like that about it.
